page.shortlink: application server settings access and errors
page.description: Settings for adding custom error handler pages and access restrictions, including directory browsing and IP restrictions.

discussion.p: Settings for configuring access and error pages are found in *[ui:Access and Errors]*. Access settings allow you to enable or disable directory browsing as well as create IP restrictions which can be used to explicitly allow or deny access to applications served by the Application Server to specific IP addresses.
Error settings control how the Application Server should handle errors Custom HTTP error pages to show when the server sends a 40x or 50x error to the client can be specified here.

item.name: Enable Directory Browsing
item.description: Show the contents of a directory if it does not include a default page. Default pages are specified on the General tab.

item.name: IP Restrictions
item.description: Configure restrictions to explicitly allow or deny access to the server by IP address.

item.name: Enable
item.description: Enable or disable IP address restrictions.

item.name: Allow/Deny
item.description: Choose whether to allow or deny access to the server by clients with the specified IP addresses.

item.name: IP Addresses
item.description: The list of IP address to Allow or Deny.

item.name: Errors
item.description: Configure custom error pages and additional content to include on error pages generated by the Application Server.

item.name: Include server signature on error pages
item.description: Toggles whether or not to include the server's standard signature on error messages sent back to clients. Below is an example of an error page with the server signature highlighted.

item.name: Error Pages
item.description: Specify the page to display for a specified HTTP error code. The page can be an .a5w or .html page. See explanation below.
